Package simulation.montecarlo

Class Lattice

java.lang.Object
simulation.montecarlo.Lattice
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Lattice extends Object implements Serializable
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    private class 
    Lattice.MagneticMomentsSolveIter
    Class of methods used to find a self-consistent solution for the magnetic moments All methods here should be considered as ruining the singleSpin[] lattice in case an exception is thrown, hence a copy should be made before calling them.

  • Constructor Details

    • Lattice

      public Lattice​(int Lx, int Lz, double x, double extBx, double extBy, boolean suppressInternalTransFields, double spinSize, boolean[] dilution, double[][][] intTable, double[][] exchangeIntTable, int[][] nnArray, FieldTable energyTable, FieldTable momentTable, ObservableExtractor measure)
      Constructs a new Lattice object
      Parameters:
      Lx - linear system size along the x direction
      Lz - linear system size along the z direction
      x - concentration of magnetic ions (x=1 means no dilution)
      extBx - ,extBy external transverse field (x and y directions)
      suppressInternalTransFields - whether to suppress internal transverse fields (exclude offdiagonal dipolar terms)
      spinSize - the typical magnetic moment of the spins
      dilution - boolean array that indicates which spins exist (true) and which are diluted (false)
      intTable - table of pairwise interactions (dipolar and exchange) between spins
      exchangeIntTable - Object used to obtain the energy of a single spin under a given applied magnetic field
      nnArray - table of the nearest neighbors of each spin
      energyTable - Object used to obtain the energy of a single spin under a given applied magnetic field
      momentTable - Object used to obtain the magnetic moment of a single spin under a given applied magnetic field
      measure - Object that performs measurements on the lattice

      public Lattice​(int Lx, int Lz, double extBx, double extBy, boolean suppressInternalTransFields, double spinSize, double[][][] intTable, double[][] exchangeIntTable, int[][] nnArray, FieldTable energyTable, FieldTable momentTable, ObservableExtractor measure)
      Constructs a new Lattice object with no dilution (x=1)

    • Lattice

      public Lattice​(Lattice other, boolean newSuppressInternalFields)
      Constructor that (deep) copies a given Lattice, but sets a new value for suppressInternalFields. Used for measuring what the internal transverse fields would be had they not been suppressed.
      Parameters:
      other - Lattice to copy
      newSuppressInternalFields - New value for suppressInternalFields

      public void checkerBoard()

    • flipSpin

      public int flipSpin​(int maxIter, double tol, int flipSpin, double alpha, org.apache.commons.math3.random.MersenneTwister rnd) throws ConvergenceException
      Flip a given spin and find new magnetic moments self-consistently
      Parameters:
      maxIter - - Maximum iterations for iterative solver (Gauss-Seidel)
      tol - - Tolerance for self-consistent solution. Given in terms of the average deviation per spin
      flipSpin - - Index of the spin to flip
      alpha - - Relaxation parameter for iterative solver.
      rnd - - Random number generator used for some solvers that need random initial states
      Returns:
      the index of the last method used to solve the self-consistent calculation
      Throws:
      ConvergenceException - when no convergence is achieved after trying all available methods.

    • updateAllMagneticMoments

      public void updateAllMagneticMoments​(int maxIter, double tol, double alpha)
      Calls the simple iterative solver
      Parameters:
      maxIter - maximum number of iterations allowed
      tol - tolerance for convergence
      alpha - relaxation parameter of the update step
      See Also:
      Lattice.MagneticMomentsSolveIter.updateAllMagneticMoments(int[], int, double, double, int, boolean, double, boolean, boolean)

    • solveSelfConsistentCalc

      private singleSpin[] solveSelfConsistentCalc​(int maxIter, double tol, int flipSpin, int method, int[][] nnArray, double alpha, org.apache.commons.math3.random.MersenneTwister rnd) throws ConvergenceException
      Wrapper method that solves the self-consistent calculation following a spin-flip
      Parameters:
      maxIter - maximum number of iterations allowed
      tol - tolerance for convergence testing
      flipSpin - the flipped spin
      method - method number to use
      nnArray - array of nearest neighbors (used for determining the update order)
      alpha - relaxation parameter of the update step
      rnd - random number generator to create random initial guesses
      Returns:
      the lattice object with the solved self-consistent calculation
      Throws:
      ConvergenceException - if the given method failed to converge to a solution within the given tolerance

    • orderBFS

      protected int[] orderBFS​(int n, int root)
      Returns new int array which has the breadth-first order with respect to the given spin index
      Parameters:
      n - is the maximum (arr.length)
      root - root of the tree, i.e. the flipped spin from which we start the breadth-first search
      Returns:
      array that contains the spin numbers in the BFS order

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      copy of the given array

    • updateAllLocalFields

      public void updateAllLocalFields()
      Updates all of the local fields according to the current magnetic moments

    • magneticMomentConvergence

      private double magneticMomentConvergence​(int flipSpin, double frac, boolean smoothHomotopy)
      Calculates the distance from convergence. Parameters are used when using a method which mixes the flipped spin and therefore has a different target magnetic moment for that spin.
      Parameters:
      flipSpin - the spin that is being flipped
      frac - at what fraction to mix the current spin state with the opposite spin state
      smoothHomotopy - whether to mix the spin states in a smooth way, such that the magnetic moment of "up" becomes that of "down" with no singularities, or naively as a weighted average
      Returns:
      distance from convergence

    • magneticMomentConvergence

      private double magneticMomentConvergence​(int flipSpin, double frac)
      Calculates the distance from convergence, with smoothHomotopy=false.
      See Also:
      magneticMomentConvergence(int, double, boolean)

    • magneticMomentConvergence

      public double magneticMomentConvergence()
      Calculate the magnetic moment convergence without any fractional (mixed) spins.
      See Also:
      magneticMomentConvergence(int, double, boolean)

    • magneticMomentConvergence

      private double magneticMomentConvergence​(int flipSpin)
      Calculate the magnetic moment convergence without any fractional (mixed) spins. flipSpin is ignored (which is required for homotopicSolve2), i.e. stays in the starting orientation
      See Also:
      magneticMomentConvergence(int, double, boolean)

    • updateFieldsAfterSpinSizeChange

      private void updateFieldsAfterSpinSizeChange​(int i, double prevSpinSize)
      Update all magnetic fields after a specific change of one magnetic moment
      Parameters:
      i - the index of the spin whose magnetic moment was just changed
      prevSpinSize - the previous magnetic moment (before the change)

    • verifyAllLocalFields

      public boolean verifyAllLocalFields()
      Verifies that all local fields are in agreement with the current mgnetic moments (within 1.0e-10)
      Returns:
      whether or not the current local fields are consistent w/ the current magnetic moments

    • receiveIsingLattice

      @Deprecated static singleSpin[] receiveIsingLattice​(int fileNumber, double dilution, int Lx, int Lz, double h, org.apache.commons.math3.random.MersenneTwister rnd) throws IOException
      Deprecated.
      since the dilution profile is created at the beginning of the simulation and is received instead of created here. Use generateIsingLattice(int, int, double, boolean[]) instead.
      Reads a lattice from file and creates initial random configuration Only required when there is disorder, i.e. dilution is less than 1.0.
      Parameters:
      fileNumber - - as in "config_%Lx%_%Lz%_%x%_%h%_%fileNumber%.txt
      dilution - - dilution of Ising lattice
      Lx - - number of unit cells in x direction of the lattice
      Lz - - number of unit cells in z direction of the lattice
      h - - standard deviation of the random local field
      rnd - - MersenneTwister PRNG. Used to make the random starting configuration
      Returns:
      Received Ising lattice
      Throws:
      IOException

    • generateIsingLattice

      public static singleSpin[] generateIsingLattice​(int Lx, int Lz, double spinSize, boolean[] dilution)
      Generates a singleSpin array of the system
      Parameters:
      Lx - Number of unit cells in x and in y directions
      Lz - Number of unit cells in z direction
      spinSize - the typical magnetic moment to assign to each spin in the returned array
      dilution - a boolean array that represents the dilution profile, i.e. which spins exist and which do not
      Returns:
      An array of spins that represent a Lx*Lx*Lz crystal with all local fields set to zero and all spin sizes set to the given value.

    • getCompactArrayIndex

      public static int getCompactArrayIndex​(boolean[] dilution, int index)
      Get the index in the compact spin array that corresponds to the given index in the full spin array.
      Parameters:
      dilution - - array that holds the dilution config
      index - - index in the full array
      Returns:
      corresponding index in the compact array
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - when index is larger than the size of the given dilution array
